thread.title: Ben Roethlisberger 'relatively pain-free' at Steelers practice
thread.title_full: Ben Roethlisberger 'relatively pain-free' at Steelers practice

author: customerservice@sportingnews.com (Gabrielle McMillen)
title: Ben Roethlisberger 'relatively pain-free' at Steelers practice
text:
Ben Roethlisberger 'relatively pain-free' at Steelers practice Sporting News 18 hrs ago customerservice@sportingnews.com (Gabrielle McMillen) Â© Gene J. Puskar/AP Photo Injured Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger passes with the team before Sunday's game against the Cardinals in Pittsburgh. Ben Roethlisberger's trial of his his new knee brace in practice seemed to go well Wednesday.
AdChoices "I thought I threw the ball really well," the Steelers quarterback said , also adding that he felt "relatively pain free."
MORE: Week 7 NFL power rankings | Roethlisberger trolls NFL with fake cell phone during game
If Roethlisberger continues his speedy recovery, he could start as early as Sunday against the Chiefs. But until he is cleared, third-string quarterback Landry Jones is expected to start .
Roethlisberger initially sustained the injury when he took a low hit in the Steelers' Week 3 win over the Rams. He was originally expected to miss four to six weeks, but has quickly progressed with the injury.
